To: (Name): Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington)

Subject: Redmine Account for USAID
Body:
All,

I am attempting to setup what tools and systems we have used in the past. 



Redmine is a project management tool for development which we have used in the past. This may be more useful during the web development and/or ServiceNow intake tool development to manage tasks, bugs, and features. Please register at the link below.

 

http://10.118.4.223:82/account/register <http://10.118.4.223:82/account/register> 






After account creation, you should received an email with an activation link. Likely, the activation link will be broken. 

The fix: If you receive a link like this: http://localhost:3000/account/activate?token=02e3d5f51f602dd016cf1e1891fa20487385da1d <http://localhost:3000/account/activate?token=02e3d5f51f602dd016cf1e1891fa20487385da1d>  just replace “localhost:3000” with “10.118.4.223:82” and you’re good to go.


Let me know if you have questions or run into any other problems.

 

Thanks,
Kyle

 

Kyle R. McConnell
Consultant | Deloitte Consulting

Deloitte Consulting LLP 

Mobile: +1 202 7940249

kymcconnell@deloitte.com <mailto:kymcconnell@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>

Subject: RE: What's up?
Body:
Thanks Kyle! [And hi Henry, welcome aboard!] This all sounds excellent. Feel free to keep me in the loop as things progress, new data is received [fingers crossed], or client demands change.

 

Emily – Let me know what kind of regressions you are running. I may start loading and formatting gov’t-wide FEVS data from prior years, and your work might generate some good ideas about how we should look at the wider data set.

 

Thanks again guys. Don’t be shy about letting me know if you need anything. I’m always available by text at 703.772.6739.

 

~Mark

 

 

 

Mark L. Donahey
Deloitte Consulting, LLP
Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342
www.deloitte.com

 

From: McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) 
Sent: Monday, November 21, 2016 12:31 PM
To: Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>; Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>; Carbajales, Henry (US - Arlington) <hcarbajales@deloitte.com>
Subject: RE: What's up?

 

Hey Mark,

Vered: is working on slides for an explanation to the client on how we will be working with our checklist and confirming all the details of what reports need. Additionally, it is to clarify to them that we will need to work together closely to meeting their needs and hopefully exceeding those requirements.

Henry: has been spending some time reviewing the project scope and all the documentation. I will likely set him up later with instances of Git repositories so we can walk through the potential web apps we might be developing.

Shehzad and Ray: are meeting with the Client to learn more about some of their other FEVS analyses and connect with Elliott. 

Durga: is editing the SharePoint Intake tool and making sure it’s functional, pretty enough (but not too much more UX work), and ready for internal use.

Emily: is doing some regressions in Excel at the moment. We determined as a group, that we will learn Python, so that we won’t have to learn it later and we will be able to verify each other’s coding scripts and logic.

 

However, at the moment, we decided as our python guru, we will wait for you to walkthrough some of the basic functions of Python as a DML (Data Manipulation Language), rather than sputter and not push forward on the bullying determination.

Kyle: I’ve spent a fair amount of time setting up Emily and Durga computers with Python and a number of the packages we will likely use. I am going to now link up Henry to Git and after that help Durga with the SharePoint.



Thanks,

Kyle R. McConnell
Consultant | Deloitte Consulting

Deloitte Consulting LLP 

Mobile: +1 202 7940249

kymcconnell@deloitte.com <mailto:kymcconnell@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>

Subject: RE: USAID Bullying Index - Next Steps
Body:
Roopa, 

Thank you for the comprehensive update. A few additional points. I am also including the workplace(TO3 J) team and workplace- specific tasks:

·        Draft FEVS infographic to be sent out as summary to participating populations. Timeline TBD. (Sarah, please take point on this).

·        Develop a new slides on The Anatomy of the USAID Bully (Hunter, please take point on this – Carl will be around tomorrow morning, so you and I can briefly connect with him on what he wants to see here) 

Also, quick clarifications / background:

·        I understood that they had 80 interested volunteers, but they selected 7 people to drive the CoS

·        Eileen Simoes and Elliot (didn’t get his last name) are leading the FEVS analysis and action planning for USAID (we will likely be working closely with them moving forward). 

 

Have a good night everyone, 

Maria 

 

 

From: Sanwardeker, Roopa (US - Arlington) 
Sent: Tuesday, November 15, 2016 10:33 PM
To: Bashir, Shehzad (US - Arlington) <shebashir@deloitte.com>; Donahey, Mark (US - Arlington) <mdonahey@DELOITTE.com>; McConnell, Kyle (US - Arlington) <kymcconnell@DELOITTE.com>; Parr, Ray (US - Arlington) <raparr@DELOITTE.com>; Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) <dravindra@deloitte.com>; Bicks, Emily (US - Arlington) <embicks@deloitte.com>; Idan, Vered (US - Arlington) <vidan@deloitte.com>
Cc: Bennett, Carl (US - Arlington) <carbennett@deloitte.com>; Demeke, Maria (US - Arlington) <mdemeke@deloitte.com>; Reilly, Kate (US - Arlington) <kreilly@deloitte.com>
Subject: USAID Bullying Index - Next Steps

 

Team – 

 

Below is a high level summary and next steps based on today’s meeting. Carl, Maria – please add in if I missed anything.

 

Though FEVS analysis has been done, Brenda, Elliott, and Ilene were happy with the index factors that were explored through our work.  They were in agreement with the factors chosen and thought the analysis results were consistent with their knowledge of the bureaus and departments. The COS (comprised of ~80 volunteers) is meeting on Thursday and Brenda wants Deloitte to support the meeting with our slides and Tableau dashboard. They were also interested in further exploring FEVS analysis and ideas on further socializing the results with stakeholders. 

 

Below is a summary of next steps, owners and associated due dates.

·        Update Tableau heat map dashboard with FY16 data. Due by tomorrow noon (Shehzad + team).

·        Create views in Tableau dashboard to show cuts with filters around employee type (FSN, PSC, etc.) based on new dataset from Elliott. Specially, they are looking to know the dimension scores with these filters. The speculation is that FSNs or FSOs may exhibit certain behaviors. Due by tomorrow noon. (Shehzad + team).

·        Updated timeline slide to include the following next steps. Due tomorrow noon (Shehzad + team).

o   Refine question mapping based on COS

o   Add business outcome data (claims, attrition, etc.). Interesting side note: Curtailment (leaving a mission early) could be another potential data point. 

o   Conduct survey as needed

o   Conduct qualitative analysis (focus groups)

o   Determine anatomy of a bully

o   Conduct social network analysis 

o   Design recommendations

·        Determine FEVS infographic to be sent out as summary to participating populations. Timeline TBD. (Maria + TO3 team).

 

Happy to answer any questions or provide more detail. 

Thanks,

Roopa

 

Roopa Sanwardeker

Senior Manager

Deloitte Consulting, LLP

Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097

rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 

 

Please consider the environment before printing.

Subject: USAID today
Body:
Team – 

 

I wanted to thank you and recognize all your hard work in pulling together the materials for today’s meeting under such a tight timeframe. Brenda really liked it and was impressed with our work, which was both thoughtful and analytically driven. Looking forward to working on more requests like this with all of you over the next year. 

 

I will send out a summary of meeting notes shortly that summarizes key points and our next steps. 

 

Roopa

Body:
Hey all, 

I’m checking in on the request below. I’m going to do my final collection at 2pm today. We’re going to visually display everyone’s business chemistry by TO. It would be really nice to have everyone represented. It should take about 10 seconds. 

All the best, 

Paul

Hello all,  
 
For our upcoming team meeting we are doing some account team Business Chemistry! For a successful session we need to aggregate everyone’s results.  

In order to aggregate everyone's Business Chemistry results,  we need you to click on the link below and log in. That's it. 
 
The link is right here: 
https://businesschemistry.deloitte.com/?sessionid=4ed7fa47-0f52-4ca9-8389-9af8ce70b992 
 
(You can also take the test if you have not already). 
 
Once on the page, click the log in button at the top right hand corner and log in (some of you will already be logged in). Then you're good to go! If everyone could do this by Tuesday at 11am  it would be greatly appreciated :). 


Paul Hailey

Body:
Hi all – I’m going off line for a few hours now.

 

Shehzad – I’ve attached the formatted input excel file for the new Tableau heatmap – See the “Formatted” tab in the file. You can change which questions are included in the totals displayed in “Formatted” by modifying the “Included Qs” tab. Feel free to text or call me at 703.772.6739 if you need anything this morning.

 

Thanks!

Mark

Subject: iRPM and Check-ins
Body:
Hi Team, 

 

I went ahead and setup a USAID team in iRPM. I’d recommend starting with setting up a snapshot request every two months, but I’m definitely open to a more/less frequent timeframe if you’d like. In addition, please feel free to setup time on my calendar for a one-on-one bi-weekly (or as frequent as you think is appropriate) check-in for feedback. Let me know if you have any questions. 

 

Thanks,

Shehzad

Subject: Tableau License Requests
Body:
All,

 

Please find the instructions to download and install your copy of Tableau Desktop Professional from the Deloitte Software catalog. Currently the software catalog maintains download links for versions 8.2, 8.3, 9.0 ,9.2 and 9.3 which you may download depending on the version being used on your current project so please check before downloading.  If you have an earlier version of Tableau currently installed you can choose to either uninstall it after downloading a later version or leaving it installed since the system allows a user to have multiple versions. Best practice however is to uninstall an earlier version if you know if will no longer be needed. If you have an expired or functioning trial version of Tableau loaded you must uninstall and reboot prior to initiating a download from the Deloitte Software catalog.

 

To download your version of Tableau Desktop Professional install from the Deloitte Software Catalog; https://softwarecatalog.deloittenet.deloitte.com/ESD/Packages.aspx <https://softwarecatalog.deloittenet.deloitte.com/ESD/Packages.aspx>   , navigate to the Tableau folder and then download the appropriate version of the software required. Deloitte’s Tableau license will be embedded in your new Tableau Desktop upon download.  If you have any issues or questions regarding the Tableau Desktop installation, please contact the US Technology Call Center at ustechnologycallcenter@deloitte.com <mailto:ustechnologycallcenter@deloitte.com> .  Please allow a few hours before attempting to download the software since I just added your name to our active directory which takes time to replicate within the system. 

 

Best Regards,

 

Michael R. Petrillo

Specialist Leader

Deloitte Consulting LLP

33rd Floor, 185 Asylum Street, Hartford, CT, 06103

Tel/Direct: +1 860 725 3067 | Mobile: +1 203 446 1838

mrpetrillo@deloitte.com <mailto:mrpetrillo@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>

Subject: USAID HRT Team Meeting
Body:
Hi all,

We would like to set aside time for a team-wide meeting now that we’ve had our client scope discussion.  During the meeting, we plan to walk through the full scope of each team, go through PMO logistics, and there will be a few surprises along the way.  

We’ll have breakfast at the meeting and will be sending out a team kick-off happy hour event invite for Wednesday evening.  

We look forward to meeting with everyone next week!

Best,
Mara

Subject: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs!

 

Rosslyn Human Capital Community,

 

By way of introduction, Emma Iezzoni <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  and I will be serving as the Tableau SMEs for the Rosslyn office this year. As HC Tableau Rosslyn office SMEs, we will be focused on accelerating Tableau engagement across our community by serving as points of contact, helping develop practitioners’ skills, and also offering advisory support on engagements.

 

First and foremost: The CoP is excited to launch a Tableau 101 course aimed specifically at Human Capital Practitioners. Would you be interested in attending a live Tableau 101 training in this office? Please make sure to use the voting buttons to respond.

 

Click bar at top of message to use voting buttons:



 

We are also looking to this community to help us understand how we can support you better. 

·        Do you need clarification about how the license request process works?

·        Are there any particular Tableau-related topics or applications you would like to receive training on? 

·        Do you have specific questions on how to do something in Tableau, need deliverable samples, or are looking for a Tableau resource to staff on your project? 

·        Is there something you’ve looked for and wished you could find on the HC Tableau CoP website <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx> ?

·        If you already use Tableau, are there any challenges holding you back from using Tableau more? 

 

If you have other questions, suggestions, or any comments in general to help us gauge what this HC community needs, We’d love to hear them. Please feel free to reach out to us at any time to talk anything Tableau. 

 

Thanks!

Emma Iezzoni and Dominic Morgan

				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

				 

				Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

				 

				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

				 

				Background

				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

				 

				Data Needed

				·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

				·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

				·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

				·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

				·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

				 

				Suggested Timeline

				·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

				·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

				·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

				·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

				 

				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

				 

				Thanks,

				Roopa

				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

				 

				Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

				 

				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

				 

				Background

				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

				 

				Data Needed

				·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

				·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

				·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

				·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

				·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

				 

				Suggested Timeline

				·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

				·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

				·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

				·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

				 

				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

				 

				Thanks,

				Roopa

				 

				Roopa Sanwardeker

				Senior Manager

				Deloitte Consulting, LLP

				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>

			Team – Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating “Carl Bennett’s anti-bullying index” over the next few days.

			 

			TO2’s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.

			 

			Tomorrow

			·       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)

			Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

			 

			Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

			 

			We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

			 

			Background

			HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

			 

			Data Needed

			·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

			·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

			·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

			·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

			·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

			 

			Suggested Timeline

			·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

			·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

			·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

			·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

			 

			Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

			 

			Thanks,

			Roopa

			Deloitte Consulting, LLP

				Team – Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating “Carl Bennett’s anti-bullying index” over the next few days.

				 

				TO2’s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.

				 

				Tomorrow

				·       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)

				·       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate

				·       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)

				 

				Friday

				·       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID

				·       Interpret results

				·       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership

				 

				Monday

				·       Incorporate feedback

				·       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)

				 

				Tuesday

				·       Delivery to client! J 

				 

				Please let us know if you would prefer a different approach or this is duplicative with work already being done.

				 

				Thanks!

				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

				 

				Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

				 

				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

				 

				Background

				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

				 

				Data Needed

				·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

				·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

				·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

				·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

				·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

				 

				Suggested Timeline

				·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

				·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

				·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

				·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

				 

				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

				 

				Thanks,

				Roopa

				 

				Roopa Sanwardeker

				Senior Manager

				Deloitte Consulting, LLP

				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097

				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 

				 

				Please consider the environment before printing.

Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
Body:
Hey Roopa – Durga is looking into a room for 10:00 AM and I’m checking in with Hunter and Camille to see if there’s anything they can have ready by then re: the draft one-pager slide we talked about.

 

Can you give us a sense of what a brainstorming session with Carl entails and what level of personnel he would want in the room. I’d like our whole team there if possible, but he’s also roped in a lot of other folks. 

 

Also, if we can’t find a room, do you think this is a conversation that could occur in the shared space outside his office, utilizing the rolling whiteboards we have now?

 

Thanks!

Mark

 

Mark L. Donahey
Deloitte Consulting, LLP
Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342
www.deloitte.com

			We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

			 

			Background

			HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

			 

			Data Needed

			·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

			·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

			·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

			·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

			·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

			 

			Suggested Timeline

			·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

			·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

			·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

			·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

			 

			Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

			 

			Thanks,

			Roopa

			 

			Roopa Sanwardeker

			Senior Manager

			Deloitte Consulting, LLP

			Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097

			rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/>

To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points.

				TO2’s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.

				Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

				 

				Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

				 

				We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

				 

				Background

				HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

				 

				Data Needed

				·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

				·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

				·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

				·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

				·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

				 

				Suggested Timeline

				·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

				·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

				·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

				·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

				 

				Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

				 

				Thanks,

				Roopa

				 

				Roopa Sanwardeker

				Senior Manager

				Deloitte Consulting, LLP

				Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097

				rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 

				 

				Please consider the environment before printing.

		Team – Given the tight timeline and the interconnectivity with the TOs, I wanted to confirm the sausage making that will go into creating “Carl Bennett’s anti-bullying index” over the next few days.

		 

		TO2’s activities should roughly align to the schedule below. We will work in close conjunction with Mike and the SRC, as well as TO3.

		 

		Tomorrow

		·       Do some research around anti-bullying (e.g. articles, other agency activities, etc.)

		·       Identify potential FEVs questions that may relate

		·       Examine existing tools and analysis (e.g. inclusion index, etc.)

		 

		Friday

		·       Conduct data analysis based on any data that comes in from USAID

		·       Interpret results

		·       Circulate initial thoughts to leadership

		 

		Monday

		·       Incorporate feedback

		·       Make a client ready presentation (slides maybe? Tableau maybe?)

		 

		Tuesday

		Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

		 

		Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

		 

		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

		 

		Background

		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

		 

		Data Needed

		·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

		·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

		·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

		·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

		·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

		 

		Suggested Timeline

		·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

		·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

		·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

		·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

		 

		Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

		 

		Thanks,

		Roopa

		 

		Roopa Sanwardeker

		Senior Manager

		Deloitte Consulting, LLP

		Mobile: +1 571 429 0947 | Fax: +1 877 351 5097

		rsanwardeker@deloitte.com <mailto:rsanwardeker@deloitte.com>  | www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com/> 

		 

		Please consider the environment before printing.

On Nov 10, 2016, at 9:03 AM, Knight, Michael (US - Arlington) <miknight@deloitte.com <mailto:miknight@deloitte.com> > wrote:

	From my perspective, and based on the conversation with Carl, I would suggest focusing on the following FEVS items to construct the Bullying Resilience index. These are proximal measures at  the best of an anti-bullying workplace culture, but the since the FEVS is a standard survey there are not many items that address bullying, workplace violence, coercion, or hostile working environment in any direct way.

FEVS Items

Question

Survey Section

(36) My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.

My Agency

(34) Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).

My Agency

(37) Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.

My Agency

(49) My supervisor treats me with respect.

My Supervisor

(17) I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule or regulation without fear of reprisal.

My Work Experience

(20) The people I work with cooperate to get the job done.

My Work Unit

	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

	 

	Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

	 

	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

	 

	Background

	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

	 

	Data Needed

	·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

	·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

	·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

	·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

	·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

	 

	Suggested Timeline

	·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

	·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

	·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

	·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	 

	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

	 

	Thanks,

	Roopa

Please and thank you,

		Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

		 

		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

		 

		Background

		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

		 

		Data Needed

		·         FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

		·         FY16 EEO claims (optional)

		·         FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

		·         FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

		·         Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

		 

		Suggested Timeline

		·         HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

		·         Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

		·         HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

		·         Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

		 

		Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

		 

		Thanks,

		Roopa

Subject: Anti-Bullying Index
 
Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 
 
We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 
 
Background
HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 
 
Data Needed
	*       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)
	*       FY16 EEO claims (optional)
	*       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)
	*       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)
	*       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)
 
Suggested Timeline
	*       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10
	*       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15
	*       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16
	*       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17
 
Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!
 
Thanks,
Roopa

Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
Body:
We’ve consolidated the FEVS question list agreed upon these bullying-related questions. Note that we marked questions with asterisk if we could not agree on the relevance of a question:

15, 17, 20, 22*, 30, 34, 37, 38, 42, 46, 48, 49, 54, 55, 59* 

 

15.   My performance appraisal is a fair reflection of my performance.

17.   I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule, or regulation without fear of reprisal

20.   ***The people I work with cooperate to get the job done

22.   Promotions in my work unit are based on merit.

30.   Employees have a feeling of personal empowerment with respect to work processes.

34.   Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).

37.   Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.

38.   Prohibited Personnel Practices (for example, illegally discriminating for or against any employee/applicant, obstructing a person's right to compete for employment, knowingly violating veterans' preference requirements) are not tolerated.

42.   My supervisor supports my need to balance work and other life issues.

46.   My supervisor provides me with constructive suggestions to improve my job performance

48.   My supervisor listens to what I have to say.

49.   My supervisor treats me with respect.

54.   My organization's senior leaders maintain high standards of honesty and integrity.

55.   Supervisors work well with employees of different backgrounds

59.   ***Managers support collaboration across work units to accomplish work objectives.

	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

	 

	Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

	 

	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

	 

	Background

	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

	 

	Data Needed

	·        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

	·        FY16 EEO claims (optional)

	·        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

	·        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

	·        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

	 

	Suggested Timeline

	·        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

	·        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

	·        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

	·        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	 

	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

	 

	Thanks,

	Roopa

		Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

		 

		We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

		 

		Background

		HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

		 

		Data Needed

		·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

		·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

		·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

		·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

		·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

	 

	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

	 

	Background

	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

	 

	Data Needed

	·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

	·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

	·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

	·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

	·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

	 

	Suggested Timeline

	·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

	·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

	·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

	·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	 

	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

	 

	Thanks,

	Roopa

Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

 

Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

 

We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

 

Background

HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

 

Data Needed

·        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

·        FY16 EEO claims (optional)

·        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

·        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

·        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

 

Suggested Timeline

·        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

·        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

·        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

·        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

 

Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

 

Thanks,

Roopa

HH

	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

	 

	Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

	 

	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

	 

	Background

	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

	 

	Data Needed

	·       FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

	·       FY16 EEO claims (optional)

	·       FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

	·       FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

	·       Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

	 

	Suggested Timeline

	·       HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

	·       Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

	·       HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

	·       Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	 

	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

	 

	Thanks,

	Roopa

Body:
Welcome to the 'USAID HCTM Owners' SharePoint group. Ravindra, Durga (US - Arlington) (i:05.t|adfs|dravindra@deloitte.com) has added you to the 'USAID HCTM Owners' group for this SharePoint site.
Group description: Use this group to grant people full control permissions to the SharePoint site: USAID HCTM 
Welcome to the team 
As a member of this SharePoint group, you can: 
* Participate in the SharePoint site at: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM 
* View the group home page at: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/_layouts/people.aspx?MembershipGroupId=5 



What is a SharePoint site?

A SharePoint site is a Web site that provides a central storage and collaboration space for documents, information, and ideas. A SharePoint site is a tool for collaboration, just like a telephone is a tool for communication, or a meeting is a tool for decision making. A SharePoint site helps groups of people (whether work teams or social groups) share information and work together. For example, a SharePoint site can help you: 

* Coordinate projects, calendars, and schedules.
* Discuss ideas and review documents or proposals.
* Share information and keep in touch with other people.

SharePoint sites are dynamic and interactive -- members of the site can contribute their own ideas and content as well as comment on or contribute to other people's.

Subject: RE: Anti-Bullying Index
Body:
From my perspective, and based on the conversation with Carl, I would suggest focusing on the following FEVS items to construct the Bullying Resilience index. These are proximal measures at the best of an anti-bullying workplace culture, but the since the FEVS is a standard survey there are not many items that address bullying, workplace violence, coercion, or hostile working environment in any direct way.

FEVS Items

Question

Survey Section

(36) My organization has prepared employees for potential security threats.

My Agency

(34) Policies and programs promote diversity in the workplace (for example, recruiting minorities and women, training in awareness of diversity issues, mentoring).

My Agency

(37) Arbitrary action, personal favoritism and coercion for partisan political purposes are not tolerated.

My Agency

(49) My supervisor treats me with respect.

My Supervisor

(17) I can disclose a suspected violation of any law, rule or regulation without fear of reprisal.

My Work Experience

(20) The people I work with cooperate to get the job done.

My Work Unit

	Subject: Anti-Bullying Index

	 

	Hi Brenda and Cheryl – 

	 

	We really enjoyed the discussion today. As a follow up to our conversation around anti-bullying, I wanted to summarize our understanding and next steps. 

	 

	Background

	HCTM has been making progress around anti-bullying efforts at the agency. There have been plans to deploy a survey to understand the impact of bullying at the agency. To assist, Deloitte will examine USAID FEVS data to create an anti-bullying index and supplement the analysis with additional data points. 

	 

	Data Needed

	·        FEVS full FY16 dataset including de-identified individual responses with demographic data where possible (occupation, office/division, etc.)

	·        FY16 EEO claims (optional)

	·        FY16 Workers Compensation claims (optional)

	·        FY16 PTO/absence data (optional)

	·        Any qualitative information around the anti-bullying efforts (optional)

	 

	Suggested Timeline

	·        HCTM to send Deloitte FEVS and other data no later than COB tomorrow, 11/10

	·        Deloitte to provide initial analysis to USAID no later than noon on Tuesday, 11/15

	·        HCTM to provide feedback by noon on Wednesday, 11/16

	·        Deloitte to revise analysis and support HCTM on Thursday, 11/17

	 

	Happy to answer any questions. Looking forward to getting started on this analysis!

	 

	Thanks,

	Roopa

	 

	Roopa Sanwardeker

	Senior Manager

Subject: RE: USAID Scope Meeting follow up
Body:
Thanks Mike – The concept of a bullying index is a new invention straight from Carl’s mind, so this would be a custom index. Carl believes that we can adapt the inclusion index for the purpose. If we get ahold of complaint and/or absentee data as well, he believes that might help guide our choices.

 

My team is happy to take the lead on this, but if you have any tools or resources that can be adapted to this effort, we would really appreciate your guidance.

 

If my team were to develop the list of relevant questions, is it possible to generate a cross tabulation for an arbitrary set of questions? Are there any other inputs (such as relative weights of questions) that are also required for the analysis?

 

Thanks again,

Mark

Deloitte Consulting, LLP

Hi Mark – thanks for the info. I think it would be helpful to know what the specifically the Bullying Index is and how it could be extrapolated from the FEVS data, since there are no items in the standard FEVS questionnaire that actually ask about workplace bullying. Once we know how to construct the bullying index, then it would be a matter of cross tabulating which workgroups/divisions/entities have the greatest prevalence rates for bullying. Depending on the nature of the data we receive from USAID, it may be possible to evaluate the impact of high bullying prevalence rates on other HR outcomes (absenteeism, etc.) The first task is to operationalize the bullying index. Did you have any insights from the meeting on what  was meant by the concept?

Thanks

Subject: The USAID HRT team kick off meeting is coming - submit a slide to our face book!
Body:
Hello USAID team,

 

We’re compiling an old-school face book (2 words J) to help everyone learn names, faces, and karaoke preferences of the USAID HRT team. Attached is a template followed by an example from Jonathan in case you need inspiration. Please fill out the first slide and return to Katarina Jenkins by Thursday, 11/10 COB. These will be shared with the group at our team kickoff meeting which will be scheduled for early next week – invite to come. 

 

If you aren’t sure of your assigned TO yet, just leave that one blank. Let me know if you have any other questions!

 

-Carol

Subject: Federal ARA Tableau 101 Lunch & Learn
Body:
Hi Everyone,

The Tableau 101 Lunch and Learn will be held this Friday, November 11th, from 11:00am – 1:00pm in 12196 Rosslyn. 

Attendees will receive 2 hours of learning credits for the training. Please follow the link and register to receive your credit: link to register <https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01353855>  

Prior to the Tableau 101 training, we request that you download the following files for more hands on time:

1.	Tableau public: https://public.tableau.com/s/ 
2.	The US County Health Rankings data found here: https://public.tableau.com/en-us/s/resources 
*	You can also use this direct link to the file <https://public.tableau.com/s/sites/default/files/media/County_Health_Rankings.csv> 

If you have any questions or difficulties, feel free to email mgaddis@deloitte.com <mailto:mgaddis@deloitte.com> .  If needed, we will assist with this at the beginning of the class.

Lunch will be served during the event. Please reach out to me if you have any special food needs. 

Thanks,
Michael

Subject: USAID HRT PTO Guidance
Body:
Hi all,

 

As a follow up to Kate’s email, I wanted to provide guidance on the process for requesting, logging, and taking PTO.  We’ve created two different systems for logging approved PTO, one for the holidays, and another for year-round vacations.  It would be great if you could discuss holiday PTO with your team leads as soon as possible.  We also ask that you coordinate your PTO plans with your respective work-stream teams and be proactive to ensure proper coverage of meetings, deadlines, and deliverables.

 

Process for Requesting, Logging, and Taking PTO:

 

1.       Please request PTO from TO/Change leads at least 3 weeks in advance

2.       TO/Change Lead will approve/reject request

3.       If approved, please input PTO into the holiday log or SharePoint calendar, and include a contact number. We also request that you send an Outlook calendar invite to TO/Change work-stream members and mark the PTO as “free” 

4.       Finally, we request that you put together a handover memo of all outstanding tasks before you leave for PTO, and send an email to  team members covering tasks (cc TO lead) at least 24 hours prior to departure.  We request that you provide team members with at least a day to ask questions before you leave, and please make sure to inform TO/Change leads of any potential issues.

 

Logging Holiday PTO: 

 



 

We’ve created a holiday specific PTO tracker on the SharePoint site.  Please only log holiday approved PTO using the link below. Each team has their own tab to enter PTO.

 

TO/Change Leads: Please make sure that we have coverage over the holidays.  I plan to include this information on the team calendars, so we are all of coverage aware in case anything comes up.  

 

Holiday PTO Tracker: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/SitePages/Home.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2FUSAIDHCTM%2FShared%20Documents%2FPMO%2FHoliday%20PTO%20Tracker&FolderCTID=0x01200065292BC8C818474FB1BCF3727733D2AE&View={60667C0B-1629-46A8-BA6C-0206C3D24949} <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/SitePages/Home.aspx?RootFolder=%2Fsites%2FUSAIDHCTM%2FShared%20Documents%2FPMO%2FHoliday%20PTO%20Tracker&FolderCTID=0x01200065292BC8C818474FB1BCF3727733D2AE&View=%7b60667C0B-1629-46A8-BA6C-0206C3D24949%7d>  

 

Logging Year-Round PTO:

 



 

We’ve created a team calendar to log PTO on the SharePoint site for year-round vacation schedules.  Please log your non-holiday approved PTO for your respective team.  If you are supporting multiple teams, please only log PTO once on the calendar for the primary team you are supporting.  

 

·       CM: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/CM%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/CM%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>  

·       PMO: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/PMO%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/PMO%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>  

·       TO1: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO1%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO1%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>  

·       TO2: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO2%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO2%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>  

·       TO3: https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO3%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx <https://em.deloittefed.com/sites/USAIDHCTM/Lists/Calendar/TO3%20PTO%20Calendar.aspx>  

 

I’ve attached additional guidance on PTO, sick leave, and working remotely for you reference.  This slide is included in the onboarding deck in case you need to find it at a later point.  If you have any questions about the PTO process or anything else regarding the PMO, please feel free to reach out.  

 

Many thanks,

Mara

Subject: USAID update
Body:
All, 

Thank you for your patience during what has been a slower than anticipated start. In my conversations with the client, they are REALLY excited for us to get started and to make a big difference fast. They have been frustrated by having a limited staff and moving slower than they would like…so get ready for a fun, exciting, and impactful ride! 

Our client counterparts have been traveling quite a bit in order to get the word out about the HR Transformation so they have not been readily available for meetings in the last few weeks. We do have a Scope discussion on the calendar for this Wednesday however, so once we get through that we should be able to mobilize all teams. The client COR has also been delayed in getting us the security form that each person needs to fill out to initiate the background check process – we expect to receive those today and we will coordinate with everyone to get those completed. If you haven’t been connected to your team already, please reach out to your team lead to get involved as we have a lot of work to get done now. As far as staffing goes, we are fully staffed right now pending client and teaming partner scope discussions – I will let you know if there are any additional openings at the end of this week. 

We will have a team-wide meeting next week to walk through the full scope of each team, go through PMO logistics, and there will be a few surprises along the way. Prior to that, I realize we are fast approaching the holidays and thus PTO is a topic that folks are concerned about. We have a process for requesting and logging PTO that Mara will send out to everyone very soon, so keep an eye out. 

For those of you who are not aware, a few of us from the team have been working in the 13th floor lounge for now until we get seating, so please join us. We hope to find out about seating / meeting room space tomorrow, so I’ll keep you informed. We are optimistic that we’ll get seating for everyone in Rosslyn. 

Thanks everyone. I hope you had fantastic weekends. Please let me know if you have questions. 

Kate

Subject: Greetings from your Rosslyn Office Tableau SMEs!

 

Rosslyn Human Capital Community,

 

By way of introduction, Emma Iezzoni <mailto:eiezzoni@deloitte.com>  and I will be serving as the Tableau SMEs for the Rosslyn office this year. As HC Tableau Rosslyn office SMEs, we will be focused on accelerating Tableau engagement across our community by serving as points of contact, helping develop practitioners’ skills, and also offering advisory support on engagements.

 

First and foremost: The CoP is excited to launch a Tableau 101 course aimed specifically at Human Capital Practitioners. Would you be interested in attending a live Tableau 101 training in this office? Please make sure to use the voting buttons to respond.

 

Click bar at top of message to use voting buttons:



 

We are also looking to this community to help us understand how we can support you better. 

·        Do you need clarification about how the license request process works?

·        Are there any particular Tableau-related topics or applications you would like to receive training on? 

·        Do you have specific questions on how to do something in Tableau, need deliverable samples, or are looking for a Tableau resource to staff on your project? 

·        Is there something you’ve looked for and wished you could find on the HC Tableau CoP website <https://americas.internal.deloitteonline.com/sites/TableauCoP/SitePages/Human%20Capital%20Tableau%20Community%20Portal.aspx> ?

·        If you already use Tableau, are there any challenges holding you back from using Tableau more? 

 

If you have other questions, suggestions, or any comments in general to help us gauge what this HC community needs, We’d love to hear them. Please feel free to reach out to us at any time to talk anything Tableau. 

 

Thanks!

Emma Iezzoni and Dominic Morgan

Subject: Important article to read re: recruitment and hiring

 

All, 

 

The below article is a must read for your teams. It’s relevant to all three TOs. Some important actions coming out of this: 

1.      Lisa – we need to follow up with Lamont Neal about the OPM hiring data that is to be sent to agencies on Nov. 14th

2.      Lisa – we need to understand the process for getting OPM training on the hiring process so we can advise USAID on this and hopefully use OPM in the short term to train their people

3.      All – incorporate this information into your metric tracking decisions

 

It would be great to make USAID a poster-child for success against this presidential objective. As we draft our metrics, please think about how we can measure against the 3 objectives outlined in this article so we can provide USAID with the right data / information to tout their efforts to OPM and the White House.

 

https://fcw.com/articles/2016/11/03/streamline-hiring-memo.aspx

 

Thanks,

 

Kate Reilly

Subject: USAID Confidential Information Management Plan Training Requirement
Body:
USAID Confidential Information Management Plan (CIMP)
USAID practitioners,

Safeguarding confidential information is a business imperative. As stewards of Deloitte’s reputation, we can proactively coordinate the implementation of leading practices to protect CI and maintain trust.
I have attached the approved CIMP guidance for our account and listed several refresher resources below. Please take some to review the attached document and complete the Commit to Confidentiality <https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01075971>  course (send me the certificate if you have). It is the responsibility of each practitioner to understand and abide by the procedures detailed in the CIMP. 

For our account there are two main requirements for Deloitte staff:
     1. Take the Commit to Confidentiality course on Deloitte Learning Center (if you have already completed it please send me the certificate); and =
     2.  Adhere to the data access/use/storage/transfer/retention/destruction instructions on the USAID Account CI Handling Guidance (slide 3 of attachment).




We appreciate your commitment to protecting Deloitte and our clients’ data. If you have any questions regarding the safeguards and procedures listed in the CIMP, please let me or the Account Data Manager (Vanessa Ramirez <mailto:vbowne@deloitte.com> ) know. 

 	Additional Resources 	
 	 Deloitte Information Security Policy (APR310) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/310_Information_Security_US.aspx>  	
 	Deloitte Laptop Security Policy (APR340) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/340_LaptopSecurity_US.aspx> 	
 	Deloitte Personal Digital Assistants Policy (APR 360) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/360_PersonalDigitalAssistants_US.aspx> 	
 	Understand applicable Deloitte VPN guidance <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/wt/tech/nc/pages/deloittenetvpn.aspx> 	
 	Deloitte Wireless Communication Policy (APR 395) <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/About/Policies/Admin/Pages/395_WirelessCommunications_US.aspx>  	
	Deloitte Commit to Confidentiality training on DLC:
https://dlpdelc.deloitteresources.com/content.aspx?src=delus&vdr=saba&crscode=01075971

Subject: RE: Introduction

 

Hi Emily – I look forward to working with you. If you’re in Rosslyn at all this week, put some time on my calendar so we can grab coffee and talk more about the project.

 

I don’t have much first-hand experience with good resources for SQL, I’ll check with some colleagues. In the meantime, perhaps this Lynda course would be a good place to start: https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html <https://www.lynda.com/SQL-tutorials/SQL-Essential-Training/139988-2.html> . We have free access through Deloitte here: https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx <https://deloittenet.deloitte.com/CL/MLD/DLC/FSS/consulting/Pages/Lynda.com.aspx> . 

 

For Python, I’d recommend two resources that are both freely available online:

1.     Learn Python the Hard Way: https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/ <https://learnpythonthehardway.org/book/> 

2.     Automate the Boring Stuff with Python: https://automatetheboringstuff.com/ <https://automatetheboringstuff.com/> 

 

These are both great introductions to Python and programming in general, but they don’t really get into their application in analytics. I’ll see if I can find some additional resources along those lines as well.

 

Thanks!

Mark 

 

 

Mark L. Donahey
Deloitte Consulting, LLP
Tel/Direct: +1 571 858 0342
www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>

Subject: USAID - Kickoff


Hi everyone, 

We had a great kickoff meeting with USAID leadership today. They are very energized, the new CHCO (Kim Lewis) is a big proponent of the HR Transformation (phew!), and they have accomplished quite a bit in the past few months. They were really excited to have us onboard because they’ve been working hard to get a lot done and feel restricted by the lack of resources…so I hope you’re all ready to knock their socks off :). They are looking to get a lot done quickly, especially in the next two months. 

Two major things that I want to make sure everyone understands and adopts – you will continue to hear this in our meetings as these were straight from Bob Leavitt’s mouth (USAID’s HR Transformation Lead):

1.	RESPECT – This is a sensitive time at USAID so please treat everyone (I repeat, EVERYONE) with respect and be empathetic to their situation. The change they are about to endure is not easy and we may very well encounter resistance early – be ready for this and be sure to respect everyone. 
2.	ORGANIC – USAID’s vision is to have us help them grow their capability organically, so that in 5 years they can run their own operations, do their own workforce analytics, and manage their own culture. At every turn we should be thinking of ways to help them do this (automation is one way). 

The USAID PMO has been working hard to communicate the HR Transformation effort and from what they see, the skepticism that was once rampant is starting to wane. There seems to be an understanding that effective change is going to take some time to implement and people are willing to give the transformation team space to get it done (they are optimistic due to the success of the contact center implementation that is going very well). It was emphasized that that window of opportunity is SMALL and won’t last long – we will have to capitalize on the momentum the team has created and make meaningful impact early. 

With regard to any specifics around the TOs, please talk with your TO lead in the next day or two. We didn’t get to do a deep dive into any of the objectives and plan to do that with USAID the week of 11/7. In the next week, our primary objective is to complete the management plan (which some of you are working) and complete our project plans by Friday, 11/4. We will be creating an integrated project plan during the week of 11/7 (Mara – heads up :) ). We will also need assistance putting together the Performance Management Plan so stay tuned for that. 

Thanks all, see you Monday.

Kate Reilly
Federal HR Transformation
Deloitte Consulting, LLC
Tel/Direct: 571.882.8514| Mobile: 202.256.3780
www.deloitte.com <http://www.deloitte.com>

Body:
All, 

We have three distinguished guests joining us to share with us stories and experiences as children of foreign service officers, PSCs at USAID, and consultants to mission projects. The goal of this meeting is to help everyone understand the life of an employee at USAID and the impact that HR has on the employees, their families and their customers in developing countries. In order to make an impact at USAID, we must understand their culture, environment, and mission. 

Thanks all, hope you can make it. 
Kate
